info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 5:37PM EDT until July 12 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina...
Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Neuse River at Smithfield.
* WHEN...From this evening to early Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 15.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 10/13/2018. - water.noaa.gov/gauges/SMFN7
info.instruction:
Be cautious near riverbanks and on greenways near and adjacent to the river.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers.
The next statement will be issued by Friday morning.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING
